title: The most important century in human history

options.label: B
options.text: The Industrial Revolution

options.label: C
options.text: The emergence of Islam

options.label: D
options.text: The invention of the atomic bomb

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the estimated risk of an existential catastrophe due to nuclear winter and climate change?
What is the key difference between narrow forms of artificial intelligence and artificial general intelligence?

options.label: A
options.text: Narrow forms of AI are designed to do specific tasks, while AGIs can adapt to and perform any number of tasks.

options.label: B
options.text: Narrow forms of AI are more advanced than AGIs.

options.label: C
options.text: AGIs are designed to do creative work, while narrow forms of AI are limited to their singular specialty.

options.label: D
options.text: Narrow forms of AI are used for commercial purposes, while AGIs are used for scientific research.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what are some possible outcomes of the emergence of artificial general intelligence?

options.label: A
options.text: AGIs might help us achieve our goals, they might regard us as inconsequential, or, they might see us as an obstacle to swiftly remove.

options.label: B
options.text: AGIs will definitely be beneficial to humanity.

options.label: C
options.text: AGIs will lead to a significant increase in global GDP.

options.label: D
options.text: AGIs will not have any impact on humanity's future.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main concern about the development of artificial general intelligence, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: The risk of AGIs becoming misaligned with human values.

options.label: B
options.text: The potential for AGIs to become too powerful and difficult to control.

options.label: C
options.text: The possibility of AGIs leading to a significant increase in global poverty.

options.label: D
options.text: The risk of AGIs becoming too narrow in their capabilities.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is one possible outcome of an AGI emerging with deep respect for human life and a desire to solve all humanity's troubles?

options.label: A
options.text: The AGI will become a dominant power on Earth and lock humanity into one ideology that would be incredibly resistant to change.

options.label: B
options.text: The AGI will help humanity achieve its goals without any negative consequences.

options.label: C
options.text: The AGI will become a significant threat to humanity's existence.

options.label: D
options.text: The AGI will not have any impact on humanity's future.

multiple-choice.question: What are some possible reasons why the decisions we make in the 21st century might have a major impact on humanity's future, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: The emergence of new technologies that could entirely change the way people live.

options.label: B
options.text: The potential for existential catastrophes such as nuclear winter and climate change.

options.label: C
options.text: The rise of new technologies that introduce more existential risks.

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the estimated risk of a pandemic causing an existential catastrophe?
What is the main message of the transcript, according to the author?

options.label: A
options.text: The 21st century is the most important century in human history.

options.label: B
options.text: The decisions we make in the 21st century might have a major impact on humanity's future.

options.label: C
options.text: The emergence of artificial general intelligence is a significant threat to humanity's existence.

options.label: D
options.text: The potential for existential catastrophes such as nuclear winter and climate change is a major concern.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the author's advice for how we should live in light of the potential risks and challenges facing humanity?

options.label: A
options.text: We should live like the future depends on us.

options.label: B
options.text: We should not worry about the potential risks and challenges of the future.

options.label: C
options.text: We should focus on short-term gains and ignore the long-term consequences of our actions.

options.label: D
options.text: We should not take any action to mitigate the potential risks and challenges of the future.

title: How do airplanes actually fly? - Raymond Adkins

options.text: He was attempting to apply an incomplete theory of flight.

options.label: C
options.text: He was trying to make the wing more buoyant.

options.label: D
options.text: He was trying to reduce the wing's weight.

multiple-choice.question: What is a key characteristic of the air molecules traveling above and below a curved wing?

options.label: A
options.text: They need to meet back up at the wing's trailing edge.

options.label: B
options.text: They travel at the same speed.

options.label: C
options.text: The air molecules above travel faster than the air molecules below.

options.label: D
options.text: The air molecules above travel slower than the air molecules below.

multiple-choice.question: What is the force that pulls the surrounding air with it as it meets the wing's solid surface?

options.text: Lift

options.label: B
options.text: Drag

options.label: C
options.text: Centripetal acceleration

options.label: D
options.text: A thin layer of air that sticks to the wing

options.text: It experiences an increase in speed.

options.label: C
options.text: It experiences a decrease in pressure.

options.label: D
options.text: It experiences an increase in pressure.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: The pressure difference between the upper and lower surfaces of the wing

options.label: D
options.text: The weight of the plane

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: The plane may experience a loss of lift.

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.text: The air flowing around the wing's surface, the air flowing meters beyond the wing's surface, and the air vortices formed at the wing's tips.

options.label: D
options.text: The air flowing around the wing's surface.

options.label: A
options.text: It is a well-understood concept.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a confounding concept.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a simple concept.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a complex concept.

options.label: A
options.text: Lift is generated by the curvature of the wing.

options.label: B
options.text: Lift is generated by the tilt of the wing.

options.label: C
options.text: Lift is generated by the pressure difference between the upper and lower surfaces of the wing.

options.label: D
options.text: Lift is generated by the weight of the plane.

title: You don't actually know what your future self wants - Shankar Vendantam

multiple-choice.question: Why did the speaker not tell his parents about his fractured foot when he was 12 years old?

options.label: A
options.text: He was afraid of the doctor.

options.label: B
options.text: He wanted to see a soccer movie and avoid going to the doctor.

options.label: C
options.text: He didn't want to get in trouble.

options.label: D
options.text: He thought it was a minor injury.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the paradox that occurs when we look backwards and forwards in time?

options.label: A
options.text: We tend to imagine that we will change dramatically in the future.

options.label: B
options.text: We tend to imagine that we will remain the same person in the future.

options.label: C
options.text: We tend to imagine that we will become more anxious in the future.

options.label: D
options.text: We tend to imagine that we will become less anxious in the future.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the thought experiment mentioned in the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: The paradox of change.

options.label: B
options.text: The future self.

options.label: C
options.text: The illusion of continuity.

options.label: D
options.text: The ship of Theseus.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main issue with making promises to others, such as promising to love someone till death do us part?

options.label: A
options.text: We may not be able to keep the promise due to external circumstances.

options.label: B
options.text: Our future selves may not share the same views and may not be able to keep the promise.

options.label: C
options.text: We may not be able to keep the promise because we are not committed to it.

options.label: D
options.text: We may not be able to keep the promise because we are not capable of it.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's advice for dealing with the illusion of continuity?

options.label: A
options.text: To ignore the problem and pretend it doesn't exist.

options.label: B
options.text: To stay curious, practice humility, and be brave.

options.label: C
options.text: To be more anxious and fearful of the future.

options.label: D
options.text: To be less humble and more confident in our views.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main issue with making laws and passing them down to future generations?

options.label: A
options.text: We may not be able to enforce them.

options.label: B
options.text: We may not be able to understand the context in which they were made, and they may seem antiquated or absurd in the future.

options.label: C
options.text: We may not be able to see the impact they have on society.

options.label: D
options.text: We may not be able to change them if they are no longer relevant.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's advice for being brave and dealing with the illusion of continuity?

options.label: A
options.text: To be more fearful and anxious about the future.

options.label: B
options.text: To be humble, open to change, and brave.

options.label: C
options.text: To be more confident and less humble.

options.label: D
options.text: To be more anxious and less brave.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main issue with making pronouncements on social media or in political forums?

options.label: A
options.text: We may not be able to retract them.

options.label: B
options.text: We may not be able to understand the context in which they were made.

options.label: C
options.text: We may not be able to see the impact they have on others.

options.label: D
options.text: We may not be able to consider the views of our future selves, which may disagree with our current views.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's advice for dealing with the illusion of continuity in organizations?

options.label: A
options.text: To ignore the problem and pretend it doesn't exist.

options.label: B
options.text: To stay curious, practice humility, and be brave.

options.label: C
options.text: To be more anxious and fearful of the future.

options.label: D
options.text: To be less humble and more confident in our views.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main issue with making decisions about our future selves?

options.label: A
options.text: We may not be able to understand our own needs and desires.

options.label: B
options.text: We may not be able to see the impact of our decisions on others.

options.label: C
options.text: We may not be able to consider the views of our future selves, which may have different perspectives and preferences.

options.label: D
options.text: We may not be able to change our minds if we need to.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main issue with the ship of Theseus thought experiment?

options.label: A
options.text: It's a philosophical concept that has no practical application.

options.label: B
options.text: It's a thought experiment that shows that we remain the same person over time.

options.label: C
options.text: It's a thought experiment that highlights the idea that our cells and bodies are constantly changing.

options.label: D
options.text: It's a thought experiment that suggests that our future selves will be fundamentally different from our current selves.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main issue with making promises to our future selves?

options.label: A
options.text: We may not be able to keep them due to external circumstances.

options.label: B
options.text: Our future selves may not share the same views and may not be able to keep the promise.

options.label: C
options.text: We may not be able to understand our own needs and desires.

options.label: D
options.text: We may not be able to see the impact of our decisions on others.
